messages: 031ed0e36a6bae09d5a56fe0160b54a3 (07:05): how to share a folder in solaris?
8c27c6238210e78d0cff9690db08116b (07:05): solaris doesn't have folders
031ed0e36a6bae09d5a56fe0160b54a3 (07:06): yea..nfs i did that
031ed0e36a6bae09d5a56fe0160b54a3 (07:06): still cant access from windows
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:06): asciii, check out samba.. ask google
47ede784d43e72814a6b751394729d3b (07:06): don't know much about windows, but it surely has nfs client software
031ed0e36a6bae09d5a56fe0160b54a3 (07:07): share -F nfs /Desktop/shared
031ed0e36a6bae09d5a56fe0160b54a3 (07:07): thats all need to be done in solaris right?
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:08): um, there's 3rd party NFS clients for windows, but they don't work real well.  windows security model is considerably different than unix
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:08): as are its file and record locking semantics.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:08): use samba on the sun to share directories with windows systems.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:09): www.samba.org, I believe.
0ef8ee0341311e56b8a0008754347fdf (07:09): there should be a samba port built into solaris 10, I think?
47ede784d43e72814a6b751394729d3b (07:11): yeah, you're right, samba's a better bet
031ed0e36a6bae09d5a56fe0160b54a3 (07:15): i agree

7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:17): anyone know if    link#1    hme1 <---->  dumb switch   <---->   box #2   and      link#2  hme  <--->  cross over cable <----> box #2  ... then trunk  Link #1 and #2 ...  then possibly add a second ip# to the first box's hme  and have it be on another network that is flowing through the switch
47ede784d43e72814a6b751394729d3b (07:18): I've only set up trunking on solaris 8, are hme devices supported now?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:19): i think it works above the hardware level so it should work
47ede784d43e72814a6b751394729d3b (07:22): I'll research a bit as we've got a lot of trunking configs at work
47ede784d43e72814a6b751394729d3b (07:28): that's right, sun no longer calls it trunking
47ede784d43e72814a6b751394729d3b (07:28): now it's "link aggregation"
47ede784d43e72814a6b751394729d3b (07:30): Äjamesd: tell me if you get it to work, but it looks like "Interfaces must be of the GLDv3 type: xge, e1000g, and bge"
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:30): okay i will give it a try
47ede784d43e72814a6b751394729d3b (07:30): the software we have for solaris 8 only supports qfe, ce, and one other
47ede784d43e72814a6b751394729d3b (07:30): I've tried to get it working on hme's without luck
47ede784d43e72814a6b751394729d3b (07:31): but this is solaris 8 we're talking about
daa08b04a71644cbce3e6e7e5aeeb58e (07:31): jamesd, you got the interface to work?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:31): well the qfe is nothing but 4 hme's on a single card
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:31): it was the tu driver
47ede784d43e72814a6b751394729d3b (07:31): http://docs.sun.com/app/docs/doc/816-4554/6maoq01nk?a=view
daa08b04a71644cbce3e6e7e5aeeb58e (07:31): what driver were you trying before?
daa08b04a71644cbce3e6e7e5aeeb58e (07:32): o'h yeah heeh
daa08b04a71644cbce3e6e7e5aeeb58e (07:32): its always good to know your hardware
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (07:33): yeah but it was a present so how could i know
